goal.ch:
This course is designed to guide students through the production of a French-language play, fostering teamwork, creativity, language learning and cultural awareness. Along the way, students will develop acting and directing skills and learn to bring a vision to life collaboratively. 
By engaging in drama activities, students will enhance essential language skills, including vocabulary, pronunciation, enunciation, and sentence structure. The course emphasizes innovative teaching methods to improve articulation, body language, stage presence, and presentation skills, offering a dynamic approach to mastering the French language. 
By taking on both acting and directing roles, students will build confidence in speaking French, refine their communication abilities, and learn to express ideas creatively and critically.

outline.ch:
The course will include body awareness exercises aimed at improving posture, physical presence, and fostering the ability to use evocative body language, helping students to fully inhabit the performance space. The integration of vocal training with breath control and emotional expression will ensure students‘ performances are clear, compelling, and expressive.
Students will participate in performance rehearsals emphasizing French pronunciation, diction, intonation, and elocution, receiving personalized feedback to refine these skills and address specific phonetic challenges. They may also be asked to submit recordings for further tailored guidance.
Through group discussions of the selected play, students will deepen their understanding of the material, while drama exercises (such as improvisation and character exploration) will further enhance stage presence, teamwork, interaction, and performance skills.
In addition to vocal and linguistic training, students will work collaboratively on key aspects of the production, such as attire, stage fixtures, and acoustic design.
At the end of the semester, students will showcase their work by publicly performing a play selected from a curated list of works.
